body:
There’s a lot of talk about sleep these days, in particular the importance of getting enough of the good-quality variety. And it’s no wonder: we’re all busier than ever, and many of us aren’t getting enough. Top-notch bedding is one step in the right direction to remedy this, and one of the bedrocks of a good bed is quality sheets.

That’s where our MEB sheeting programs come in (courtesy of Heritage, Vue, Australian House & Garden and Darren Palmer): they’re not only exceptional quality, they’re an exceptional price, meaning peaceful slumber for all. Climb between the sheets of this Learning Moment for all the ins and outs, including how to help customers choose the perfect sheets for a good night’s rest.
title: Intro

body:
Before we get into the nitty-gritty of our MEBs and sheeting programs, there are a few things you need to know about sheets in general, namely:

• sizing
• thread count
• fabrics, and
• weaves

This section will arm you with expert knowledge on the subject of sheets, enabling you to better help your customers find exactly what they’re looking for.
title: Text Title

body:
All of our programs come in single, double, queen and king sizes, and we also have some ranges for king single and super king beds. For example, super king is offered in the following programs:


• Heritage 500TC Superior Cotton (white, charcoal and silver)
• Sheridan 1000TC Hotel Weight (snow)


Some mattresses are deeper (thicker) than others, meaning it can be difficult to fit standard-sized fitted sheets. We therefore offer queen, king and super king sheets with a 50cm depth rather than the standard 40cm in several of our core ranges.


In terms of pillow cases, standard pillows are covered in all programs. Pillow cases for Euro (European) pillows – the over-sized square pillows meant to be used decoratively on beds – can be purchased with some quilt cover sets, and they are also available in the following ranges:


• Myer 250TC Easy Care (white, sand and charcoal)
• Vue 300TC Superfine (white, sand, silver, charcoal, fade blue and mocha)
• Heritage 400TC Luxurious Egyptian Cotton Sateen (white, navy, oyster, blush, grey and mist)
• Australian House & Garden Alega Bamboo (white, natural and navy)
title: Need to know: sizes

_graphic.caption: Is higher thread count always better?

_items.text: Thread count is not the only indicator of quality: if a high TC sheet is made of a low-quality yarn, it will most likely be rougher and less durable than a lower TC sheet made of higher-quality fibre. With all of our sheets, higher TC does equal better quality because we use only the finest quality yarns, but this is not always the case with other retailers.

body: Thread count (TC) is the number of horizontal and vertical threads per sq cm. The higher the TC the finer the yarn, which makes for a softer (and heavier) sheet. Most people think that higher thread-count (TC) sheets equal better quality, which is often the case… but not always.
title: Is higher thread count always better?

body: One of life’s great simple pleasures is climbing into a bed with clean, fresh-smelling sheets and feeling the fabric against your skin. Bliss! Find out about the best fabrics for bed sheets – including how they differ in feel and purpose – to give our customers the beauty sleep they deserve.
title: Text Title

_items.body:
Long-staple cotton
‘Staple’ refers to the length of individual fibres – the fine strands that make up a piece of cotton – used in a product. Long-staple cotton is more desirable because it yields a stronger, softer, and more luxurious and durable fabric than short-staple cottons.


Cotton rich
Sheets that are a blend of cotton and some other material, typically polyester. They’re very durable, easy to care for, less prone to wrinkling (bye bye ironing!) and generally more affordable than 100% cotton sheets.


Egyptian cotton
This type of cotton fabric is often considered to be the best because it’s made of long- or extra-long-staple cotton (with its benefits outlined above). While much Egyptian cotton is, in fact, grown in Egypt, the term has become a generic name for long-staple cotton.


Supima cotton
Supima cotton is the trademarked name for pima cotton, another high-quality, extra-long-staple cotton like Egyptian cotton, however, it’s grown in the USA rather than in the Nile River Valley.
_items.title: COTTON RULES!

_items.body: Bamboo bed sheets are very soft to the touch (softer than cotton) and are a good all-rounder: they keep you cool in summer and warm in winter. They’re also kind to sensitive skin, being naturally hypoallergenic and antibacterial. Bamboo sheeting is relatively easy to spot, as the fabric has a distinctive sheen to it (it’s almost shiny).
_items.title: BAMBOO
FLANNELETTE
_items.body: One of the best things about winter! Flannelette is a brushed fabric that makes for a deliciously soft, warm and cosy sleeping experience during the colder months. When the fabric is brushed, fine fibres are raised from the loosely spun yarns to form a 'nap' (like a soft down) on one side or both sides.

Linen sheets are excellent for sleeping in during warmer weather – because the natural fabric is breathable, absorbs perspiration and allows air to circulate around your body – but also work well at other times of the year. Linen is a very strong fabric as its fibres come from the flax plant, and these are much thicker than cotton fibres.
_items.title: LINEN
JERSEY
_items.body: One for people who like the feeling of sleeping in a well-worn T-shirt (jersey is basically T-shirt material). These sheets are stretchy, smooth and oh-so soft.

body: The weave of a fabric is another contributing factor to how a sheet feels – two sheets both made with 100% long-staple cotton but using different weaves (such as plain/percale, sateen or twill) will end up being distinctively different in texture and provide different sleep experiences. No one weave is better than another – it’s very much a personal preference – although many customers prefer plain/percale sheets for their cool, crisp feel.
title: Text Title

_items.body:
Plain/percale


This, the simplest of weaves, is a fabric made with a plain/basket weave (one thread over, one thread under). Sheets woven in this way are strong and durable, and feel cool and crisp against your skin; they’re also noticeably stiffer than some other types of weave, such as sateen.

Sateen


As the name suggests, this is a satin-like weave, which is more complex than a simple basket weave. Fabrics with a sateen weave feel luxuriously silky and smooth, and have a distinct lustrous look due to the nature of the weave.

Twill


Not as common a weave for sheets as percale or sateen, a twill weave is identifiable by its pattern of diagonal parallel ribs, which create a subtle texture and a super-soft fuzzy feeling.

_incorrect.final:
Not quite.


Sateen sheets feel luxuriously smooth and silky against your skin and have a distinct lustrous look.

_partlyCorrect.final:
Not quite.


Sateen sheets feel luxuriously smooth and silky against your skin and have a distinct lustrous look.

_feedback.correct:
Top marks!


Sateen sheets feel luxuriously smooth and silky against your skin and have a distinct lustrous look.

_items.text: The fabric feels silky and smooth and has a lustrous sheen.
Because the fabric is brushed, it's super cosy in winter.
They're always made from 100% Egyptian cotton.
The fabric feels cool and crisp against your skin.

body: Which one of the following descriptions best describes sateen sheets?
title: MCQ Title

body: Now that you know the basics, let’s look at our four MEBs for sheets, each one of which represents exceptional quality and offers affordable solutions for the sweetest of dreams.
title: Text Title

body: Heritage is all about simple sophistication that has a sense of romance and elegance. It’s classic, feminine and refined, transcending seasons and time – perfect for the customer looking for longevity in their purchases.
title: Text Title

_graphic.caption: Heritage 400TC Luxurious Egyptian Cotton Sateen Program

body: A fashionable lifestyle range, Vue has a contemporary and minimalist aesthetic that covers both basic core items and seasonal trends. It’s at once practical and stylish, incorporating youthful contemporary design that’s often driven by colour and pattern, and offers affordable bedding for everyday living.
title: Text Title

body: This relaxed lifestyle brand reflects the Australian aesthetic, providing a range that’s high end, yet unpretentious and laid-back in style. Natural materials are key, as is contemporary design that’s unique and bespoke. This is easygoing, everyday living at its best, creating comfortable, warm and inviting sleeping spaces.
title: Text Title

_graphic.caption: Australian House & Garden Alega Bamboo Sheets Program

body: Darren Palmer brings high-end design within reach of Myer shoppers – it’s all about bringing a touch of luxe to the home. This is an everyday luxury brand that’s classic, considered, understated and high quality.
title: Text Title

_graphic.caption: Darren Palmer Aster Supima Sheets Program

body: Each of our MEBs offers different programs, or ranges, that cater to different customer needs, preferences and budgets. The following are some of these programs, grouped according to those offering 250 to 400 thread count (TC) sheets, and those offering 500 to 1000TC sheets (in general, higher thread-count programs come in at higher price points).
title: Text Title

_items.title: Myer 250TC Easy Care Cotton Rich
_items.body: Easy care products are hardwearing and practical, requiring no special treatment when washing or drying, and no ironing (hurrah!). These cotton rich (cotton and polyester) percale sheets have a smooth, crisp feel and are highly durable. They come in three colours and are an excellent entry-level product.
Another easy care sheet, these are made from a premium quality washed linen that’s lightweight, highly durable and becomes softer with every wash. Available in six colours from August 2018.
_items.title: Australian House & Garden 250TC Sandy Cape 100% Linen
Vue 300TC Superfine
_items.body: Superfine cotton sheeting is durable and smooth to the touch. Made from 100% cotton percale, its weave gives the fabric a crisp, fresh feeling that’s perfect for all seasons. Available in 12 colours.

These luxe sheets with a sateen finish are exceptionally soft and silky smooth. The finely woven Egyptian cotton has a two-ply weave for strength and durability, and the delicate hemstitch detail is the icing on the cake. Available in six colours.
_items.title: Heritage 400TC Luxurious Egyptian Cotton Sateen

_items.body: Made with viscose that’s naturally derived from bamboo, these bamboo blend sheets are super soft and silky smooth, and come in three colours.
_items.title: Australian House & Garden 400TC Alega Bamboo
Heritage 500TC Superior Cotton
_items.body: Made from 100% cotton, this lustrous sateen sheeting is smooth, soft and silky. It features a classic stripe on top with solid colour on the underside. Available in three colours.

_items.title: Heritage 500TC Hotel Collection
_items.body: Hotel-quality sheets that are both luxurious and durable, made with the best possible materials using the highest manufacturing standards. Available in six different ranges in various colours.
Supima cotton is up there with Egyptian cotton in terms of quality, and these ultra-soft, lustrous, sateen sheets are luxurious indeed. Available in two colours.
_items.title: Darren Palmer 600TC Aster Supima

_items.body: The crème de la crème. Ultra-fine 100% cotton with a sateen weave that gives a subtle sheen; indulgently soft, exquisitely designed with embroidered stitch detail, and expertly tailored. Available in three colours.
_items.title: Heritage 1000TC Finest Cotton

body:
Now that you’re equipped with detailed knowledge about all things sheet related at Myer, it’ll be a cinch to help your customers select from our range. But here are a few conversation starters to help you on your way:




❝
displayTitle: How to help your customers choose
title: Text Title

body:
Following are some tips to keep your sheets in tip-top shape:


• Always follow the care instructions and wash sheets regularly;
• Use a gentle wash cycle with warm water (unless the care label indicates otherwise);
• Avoid using bleach as it’s too harsh on natural-fibre fabrics;
• Tumble dry sheets according to label instructions, and, when possible, dry them on a clothesline out of direct sunlight; and
• Prevent stale, musty-smelling sheets by making sure they’re bone dry before storing them and keeping them in a cupboard with good ventilation.

_items.text: Remember: taking good care of sheets can add years to their life.

title: Caring for sheets

body:
Given that we spend about a third of our lives asleep, our beds are extremely important places! As such, people often invest a lot of time and money building their dream beds, and sheets are really just the beginning. So when customers come looking for sheets, it’s the ideal opportunity to suggest other related add-on products, not only to help them create something special, but also to increase your sales metrics. Some ideas:


• Cushions, pillows, pillow protectors and extra pillow cases, including Euro ones (these can really finish off a look);
• Throws and blankets, especially useful for creating a cosy winter look and feel;
• Mattress protectors, including ones that incorporate a luxurious woollen top, and electric blankets; and
• Suggesting more sheets for when this set is in the wash, or for visitors.
title: Text Title

title: MCQ Title

body: So there you have it: everything you need to know to sell our sheet programs with confidence and help your customers on their way to getting better zzzs. See our entire range of sheets and pillow cases, including from brand partners such as Sheridan, at the following link.
